abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Rhode Island's rich woodworking history is focus of August exhibit at Yale University Art Gallery; curator Patricia E Kane and her team have been compiling database that links numerous antiques and architectural ornament fragments to Rhode Island artisans, as well as clarifying provenances, correcting historical records and resolving disputes; exhibit and archive are one of many regional furniture studies.

headline.print_headline: Rhode Island Artisans and a Lively Legacy Found in Furniture
headline.main: The Smallest State Has a Rich History of Furniture Makers

snippet: Rhode Island and its woodworkers are the stars of an exhibition at the Yale University Art Gallery that focuses on the state’s furniture from 1650 to 1830....
lead_paragraph: Rhode Island and its woodworkers are the stars of an exhibition at the Yale University Art Gallery that focuses on the state’s furniture from 1650 to 1830.
